name: Steam methane reforming plant; small-scale; construction
description: This cradle to gate unit process is for the construction of one small-scale steam methane reforming plant. This model is based on European data but has been adapted to represent US conditions. Data were originally collected by Schreiber et al., 2020 and have been adapted by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL). Details for this dataset are restricted due to confidentiality. The system boundary of this dataset includes the main incoming materials with transportation and air emissions but excludes periphery materials such as cables and motors. It is important to note that this model is a rough estimation of the materials and emissions associated with constructing a small-scale steam methane reforming plant. This data should not be used for the construction of a large-scale plant due to different designs.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This unit process is representative of data collected from a study that was published in 2020. The data is based on industry process designs and simulations so specific details are confidential. This dataset has been adapted recently to reflect US conditions and to allocate flows as needed.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process is representative of the construction a small-scale steam methane reforming plant under US conditions. This study was originally conducted under European conditions. The construction process is similar in Europe and the US.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This process represents the construction of a small-scale steam methane reforming plant. Construction details are limited due to confidentiality.
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: An attributional LCI method was used to develop the dataset.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: This process was adapted from the Schreiber et al., 2020.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA: It is unknown whether a cutoff for elementary flows was used in the original study.

TREATMENT OF MISSING TECHNOSPHERE FLOWS: It is unknown whether a cutoff for elementary flows was used in the original study. Missing technosphere flows are unknown.

MASS BALANCE: The mass imbalance for this unit process is unknown.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data for the construction of a small-scale steam methane reforming plant was collected and adapted from the original study, Schreiber et al., 2020. The data in the original study was collected from design and material estimations.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The original model used European incoming datasets, which have been switched to US based incoming datasets in this model. Flows have been adapted and emissions have been calculated for this dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
BOUNDARY CONDITIONS: The system boundary includes upstream burdens from incoming materials. Periphery materials such as cables and motors are excluded from the system boundary.

DATA COLLECTION: Data were collected from Schreiber et al., 2020.

UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATION: It is unknown whether an uncertainty estimation was performed.
processDocumentation.dataCollectionDescription: Data were collected from Schreiber et al., 2020. The data for this paper was obtained from confidential modeling data and estimations and industry process designs.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: The intended application for this process is for accounting purposes as described in Goal Situation C1 from the ILCD Handbook's Detailed Guidance. LCA studies with this intended application offer "purely descriptive documentation of the system under analysis (e.g., a product, sector or country), without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy.‚Äù The studies categorized under Goal Situation C1 do NOT consider existing benefits outside the analyzed system such as recycling. The target audience of this dataset is LCA practitioners, industry, the general public, and policymakers. This model was originally built for an LCA and was originally developed and analyzed with the ReCiPe and CML2001 impact assessment methods. The completeness of elementary flows is unknown and it is not an update to a previous USLCI dataset.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This project was funded by NREL.

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG
